TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Ohoho, It's been a bizarre day. A big surprise to see this, but it makes me very happy

Now that you are rich and famous, take us all out for drinks to celebrate the success of Tantares.

Beale, Lexx Thai is right, LK has three-axis control; the thing here is that I think you and MACman have different frames of reference.

Looking engine block to Kontakt, the 40kgf thrusters provide pitch and yaw, and the 10kgf provide roll (MACman's FOR).

Looking like a cosmonaut out of the window, the 40kgf provide pitch and roll, and the 10kgf provide yaw (your FOR).

Edit:

Interestingly enough, astronauts in the LEM would have to do this frame of reference transition for CSM rendezvous, which worried some Grumman engineers a bit (the other engineers went more like "Meh, they're pilots; they'll handle"). I don't know if cosmonauts with Kontakt ever had to deal with that.

Edited March 1, 2015 by lindemherz

No. ->

And not so big. Really, KSP have lack of really small things, especially ullage engines and separation engines.

No, that is not landing radar.

http://epizodsspace.airbase.ru/bibl/energia46-96/254.jpg

At this picture landing radar shown as #17.

Thanks for the info!

I must have gone a bit brain dead reading MACman's diagrams (he has deleted his post?).

Yeah I would make the Nesting jets smaller than separatrons, plus they only need to fire for less than a second.

Now that you are rich

Bahahahah....

Beale, Lexx Thai is right, LK has three-axis control; the thing here is that I think you and MACman have different frames of reference.

Looking engine block to Kontakt, the 40kgf thrusters provide pitch and yaw, and the 10kgf provide roll (MACman's FOR).

Looking like a cosmonaut out of the window, the 40kgf provide pitch and roll, and the 10kgf provide yaw (your FOR).

Edit:

Interestingly enough, astronauts in the LEM would have to do this frame of reference transition for CSM rendezvous, which worried some Grumman engineers a bit (the other engineers went more like "Meh, they're pilots; they'll handle"). I don't know if cosmonauts with Kontakt ever had to deal with that.

I recall the LEM-orientation-thing. They made a little deal out of it in the drama series (From the Earth to the Moon? With Tom Hanks).

If people use the LK's docking window and not RPM or whatever, they'll have to switch the pitch controls, a interesting little challenge, but probably not disastrous.

I'm just now making replacement flags for the current not-so-nice agency ones.

Kerwell North West is the company I'm giving to the Gemini, ATV and Cygnus.

Any suggestions? I'm not a graphic designer, nope.

(Any submissions? That would be cool!)

OR

Edited March 1, 2015 by Beale

Congrats Beale on the new wave of popularity!

I love the ideas of the new RCS with complex thruster (although I'm not sure it can be easily implemented). I had a bizarre day too, but I'll look over already existing configs to make them ready for RealFuels and CRP update.

You are doing great! Keep up with awesome stuff!

EDIT: Oh, for the logo I might try something as well (although I'm not a designer too ).
I like the 2nd logo better than the first.
